result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Jeremy Samuels

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken and to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Fingerprinting hours are Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 9:00 A.M. - 11:00 A.M. or between 1:00 P.M. - 4:00 P.M.  DNA hours are Monday through Friday between 9:00 A.M. - 11:30 A.M.

8:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean E L Herndon Jr in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant has no counsel, is working on providing verification to SPD for service eligibility. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Defendant needs to physically go to SPD with employment/ non employment verification. BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits to allow defendant retain counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
